newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Savoy offers to buy 25.3 pct of New Star.
newsitem.headline: Savoy offers to buy 25.3 pct of New Star.

text.p: South Korea's Savoy Hotel has offered a tender to buy 25.3 percent of New Star Trading Co's shares, the Securities Supervisory Board said on Thursday.

The securities market watchdog said in a statement the Seoul-based hotel offered to buy 120,785 of New Star's shares for 62,500 won per share after receiving tenders May 6-26 through Ssangyong Investment and Securities.
The offer price is compared to the garment maker's share price in early Thursday trading at 60,000 won.
Savoy had earlier said it wanted to take over New Star.
If successful, it would be South Korea's first-ever hostile takeover of a listed company.
New Star's president and his family currently hold 29.26 percent of the company's shares, the largest single stake.

Under South Korean securities regulations put into force on April 1, those who want to buy more than 25 percent of a company's shares are obliged to offer tenders to buy shares until their total stake exceeds 50 percent.
New Star has a paid-in capital of 2.3 billion won, compared with Savoy's 8.93 billion won, the statement said.
